title: Data Engineer
description:
**Join us in building the backend that powers world-class creativity apps used by millions of people.**
=======================================================================================================


Appostrophe is a Stockholm-based mobile app studio creating easy-to-use design tools that unlock people's creativity. Our flagship app SCRL is a top-ranked design tool for social media content creation, used and loved by millions worldwide. We're a small, ambitious team expanding our platform to the web, and we need a talented Backend Infrastructure Engineer to build the foundation that will power this growth.


You'll be joining our data team to architect and build the backend systems that enable SCRL's expansion to the web, focusing on user accounts, subscription management, and cross-platform data synchronization, while at the same time strengthening our existing backend infrastructure which provides content to the millions of people using our iOS and Android app.

**What you will do**
--------------------

**Core Infrastructure & APIs**

* Design and build robust account systems supporting, among others, email+OTP authentication and cross-platform user management.
* Develop and maintain RESTful APIs for user data, project storage, and subscription management.
* Maintain secure authentication flows across web and mobile platforms.
* Build scalable storage solutions for user projects and account data.
* Strengthen our content delivery backend that returns templates, stickers and other content to all our platforms (iOS, Android, Web).
* Ensure scalability and stability of our backend across all platforms and platform versions.
* Support AI service delivery to the apps, such as our template recommendation system to suggest the right templates for our users.

**Subscription & Payment Systems**

* Architect subscription management systems integrating with an external service for web payments.
* Implement subscription syncing across iOS, Android, and web platforms.
* Build subscription status validation and premium feature access controls.
* Develop subscription plan management (upgrades, downgrades, cancellations).

**Data Security & Compliance**

* Implement GDPR-compliant data handling including consent management, data takeout, and deletion requests.
* Ensure secure backup systems and data integrity across platforms.
* Build audit trails for subscription and account changes.
* Maintain data structure consistency across web and mobile platforms.

**Platform Integration & Scaling**

* Develop backend endpoints for mobile app account integration.
* Build systems for potential third-party integrations (Instagram connectivity, etc.).
* Optimize database performance and query efficiency for millions of users.
* Implement monitoring, logging, and error reporting systems.

**You should have**
-------------------

**Technical Expertise**

* **Backend Languages**: Strong proficiency in Javascript, Typescript, React, or similar.
* **Database Design**: Experience with both SQL and NoSQL databases, understanding of data modeling for user accounts and subscriptions.
* **API Development**: Proven experience building RESTful APIs and understanding of API security best practices.
* **Cloud Infrastructure**: Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and infrastructure as code.

**System Design & Architecture**

* **Scalable Systems**: Experience building systems that handle millions of users and high-throughput scenarios.
* **Payment Integration**: Knowledge of payment processing, subscription billing, and financial data handling.
* **Security**: Understanding of authentication, authorization, data encryption, and GDPR compliance requirements.

**Product & Business Understanding**

* **Subscription Apps**: Experience with or strong interest in subscription-based app businesses and freemium models.
* **Cross-Platform Thinking**: Understanding of the complexities of syncing data and subscriptions across web, iOS, and Android.
* **Data-Driven Approach**: Comfortable working with analytics and ensuring proper event tracking for business insights.

**Collaboration & Communication**

* **Team Player**: Ability to work closely with data engineers, frontend developers, and product teams.
* **Clear Communication**: Can explain complex technical concepts to non-technical team members.
* **Problem Solving**: Self-motivated with strong analytical and debugging skills.

**We offer**
------------

* **High Impact Role**: Your backend infrastructure will power millions of users' creative projects.
* **Technical Growth**: Opportunity to architect systems from scratch and work with modern technologies.
* **Startup Environment**: Fast-paced decision making with direct impact on product direction.
* **Strong Team**: Work alongside experienced data and engineering professionals in central Stockholm.
* **Competitive Package**: Market-rate salary with opportunities for professional development.
* **Creative Culture**: Be part of a profitable company that values creativity and user experience.

title: School IT
description:
Gävle


School IT


You need to sign in to apply. You can sign in here.
Vacancy details


School Gävle
  

Position School IT
  

Position starts 1 December 2025
  

Publish date 24 September 2025 17:00
  

Closes at 24 October 2025 16:59
  

Contract type Fixed term
  

Working hours Part time
  

Working language Swedish and English
  

Contact


Name Daniel Hall
  

Phone 026-423 25 02
  

Email daniel.hall.gavle@engelska.se
  

About this vacancy


**IT Rep– Internationella Engelska Skolan Gävle**
Internationella Engelska Skolan has been making a real difference for our students for 30 years. We believe that it is thanks to our clear ethos and dedicated, present leadership that our schools provide an environment where everyone works towards common goals.


At IES Gävle, we are now looking for a temporary IT Rep. to join our team.

**About the role**
As an IT Rep, you’ll be the school’s everyday hero when it comes to IT. One moment you might be helping someone reset a forgotten password, the next you’ll be setting up accounts for a new colleague, managing phone subscriptions, or troubleshooting a projector in a classroom. The role is broad and varied – sometimes you’ll solve problems on-site, sometimes remotely.


You don’t need to be an expert from day one – what matters most is your curiosity, service-minded approach, and willingness to learn. The rest you’ll pick up along the way! **This is a 50% position**, but there is potential to combine it with other roles within the school to create a full-time position.


**Example tasks*** Managing user accounts, permissions, and passwords
* Supporting the onboarding and offboarding process for staff and students
* Administering phone subscriptions and IT equipment
* Providing basic IT support (computers, networks, printers, projectors, etc.)
* Installing and preparing laptops and mobile devices
* Supporting staff and students in using digital platforms and tools
* Creating simple guides and routines to make IT easier for everyone
* Acting as contact person for external IT providers when needed

**Who are you?**
We believe you are someone who enjoys helping others and doesn’t stress if you don’t have the answer right away. You’re solution-oriented, approachable, and find technology fun – even if you’re not an expert (yet).


Previous experience in IT or administration is a plus but not a requirement. Experience in schools or other service-oriented environments is also a bonus. It is a big plus if you enjoy working with social media and websites.

**We Offer**

* A varied role where you’ll learn and grow together with us
* A workplace full of commitment, curiosity, and teamwork
* The chance to gain hands-on experience with IT and digitalization in education
* Strong support from the HQ IT department, so you’re never alone with technical challenges


Please note: The advertisement may be closed before the application deadline if we find the right candidate.


About IES


*Internationella Engelska Skolan (IES) is a leading independent school group with academic results far above average and a diverse and energetic staff. Teaching is in both Swedish and English, and the hallways are bilingual. The language of meetings and communication amongst the staff is English.* *IES is one of Sweden's largest school groups at compulsory school level with 48 schools and around 32,000 students across the country. IES has grown steadily and maintained quality since 1993.*  

N.B. Prior to any offer of employment at IES, a criminal background check is required for all applicants. In Sweden, this is an extract from belastningsregistret from Polismyndigheten and from abroad, this is a record extract from an equivalent police governing body.

title: Product Manager
description:
Over the past eight years we have provided smart tools that help put financial power back in the hands of the people – where we believe it belongs. Everything we do is based on one vision: to improve the financial health of our users - one credit at the time.
   

  

 So far, we’ve helped millions of users by refinancing expensive consumer loans. But we aim higher; new markets, new products and new ways of improving financial lives in an innovative way. As a Product Manager you will be responsible for our core offering joining a diverse scaleup environment with co-workers who are motivated, adaptable and committed to creating fantastic (we mean amazing) products.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 We believe that everyone should get the interest rate they deserve, meaning that assisting our users with debt management will always be at the core of what we do. You’ll play a key role in shaping our core product (refinancing) while helping to explore and build new fintech solutions that people truly need. Together with a team of engineers, designers and other specialists, you’ll drive projects forward with focus, speed and a clear sense of ownership.
   

  

**Your Work Will Cover Things Like**
* Turning user needs into product opportunities and features.
* Supporting strategy by connecting product outcomes to business goals.
* Using data and insights to make smart decisions and run experiments.
* Coordinating with your team to keep roadmaps realistic, transparent and on track.
* Communicating progress and learnings across the company.


**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for someone who can make complex things simple, and who enjoys working hands-on in a fast-moving environment. You don’t need to have led large product organizations – what matters is that you’ve worked closely with engineers and designers and know how to bring an idea from concept to launch.
   

  

**We Believe You’ll Bring**
* Around 3+ years of experience in product management (or equivalent).
* Experience in building and improving digital products (web and/or app).
* Knowledge of product methodologies, user research and roadmapping.
* A strong sense of urgency and the ability to prioritize what really matters.
* A curious, commercial mindset and interest in what drives customer engagement.


 Fintech experience is a plus but not a must – we’ll help you get up to speed. What counts most is your drive to learn, execute and grow with us.
   

  

 In short we are looking for a pragmatic product generalist with a mix of business development and doer mentality. If you are still reading this we hope that sounds like a good fit? So let's get to the good stuff…
   

  

**We offer you**
 The chance to be part of something truly amazing. We aspire for a level of ambition that matches the scale of our mission. If you're ready to be a part of this transformation we want to hear from you. If you have high grit, an unwavering sense of urgency, and an unyielding commitment to excellence, we want you to be the driving force behind reshaping the financial world. This isn't just a job; it's a mission.
   

  

 We promise that you will be challenged, pushed to develop your skill set and get the opportunity to work alongside amazing and smart colleagues. At Anyfin, we hire great people and create the conditions for them to have real autonomy and impact, especially in product management. While we've had a good run so far it is what lies ahead that excites everyone that works here, and we are just getting started. Then there is the compensation package, centrally located cozy office, extra time off on your birthday and a bunch of other benefits as well. But we will get to all that in due time.
   

  

 For now begin your journey with us by clicking "Apply" below.
   

  

 We cannot wait to meet you!
   

  

*PS Please note that we are unable to provide visa sponsorship for this role.*
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Team Lead Quality Operations Pharma
company_industry: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
description:
Karo Healthcare, a dynamic and growing personal-care retail company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A.
   





 Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a
 **Team Lead - Quality Operations Pharma** 
 for our office in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   




****What's in it for you?****

 An influential leadership role in a truly international, fast-growing organization.
   

 A chance to shape global quality operations across markets and manufacturing partners.
   

 Exposure to strategic decision-making, cross-functional collaboration, and high-impact initiatives.
   

 Opportunities for continuous development and to work hands-on in a growth-oriented company.
   




**What you'll be doing**

 As Team Lead - Quality Operations Pharma, you'll play a central role in shaping how Karo partners with CMOs (Contract Manufacturing Organizations), ensuring regulatory compliance and driving efficient global quality operations. You'll lead a high-performing team and act as a key strategic partner within Global QA.
 


**Team Leadership & Strategy**
* Lead and develop the Quality Operations Pharma team through coaching, performance management, and strategic resource allocation.
* Drive competence development and ensure motivation and alignment with Karo's values and goals.
* Manage team planning, KPIs, and budget-related responsibilities.
* Act as a core member of the Global Quality Management Team, contributing to business-wide initiatives and process improvements.


**CMO Quality Oversight**
* Act as the primary point of contact for quality-related questions from Karo CMOs and internal stakeholders.
* Ensure compliance with GDP, GMP, and Directive 2001/83/EC across manufacturing and distribution partners.
* Oversee PQR management, CAPA, change control, and product compliance processes.
* Take ownership of key QA processes and report performance in Quality Management Reviews.
* Engage in strategic supplier relationship building in close collaboration with Sourcing and Global QA.


**Quality Authority & Decision-Making**
* Approve key GMP documents, specifications, validation protocols, and QA agreements.
* Act as lead auditor and approve audit reports; participate in internal audits.
* Sign off on regulatory documentation and delegate RP responsibilities as applicable.
  

  


**Requirements**
* Over
 **10 years' experience** 
 in the pharmaceutical industry.
* Deep knowledge of
 **GMP, GDP** 
 ,
 **Directive 2001/83/EC** 
 , and
 **HSLF-FS 2021:95** 
 .
* Proven experience with QA, QC, or manufacturing in regulated environments.
* **MSc in Pharmacy** 
 , or degree in engineering (life sciences), chemistry, or biology.
* Strong leadership skills with experience managing teams in cross-functional settings.
* Strategic, hands-on mindset with the ability to operate in a fast-paced, evolving business.
* Excellent communication, structured approach, and pragmatic problem-solving ability.
* A passion for continuous improvement and strong alignment with
 **Karo's values**
  

  


**Benefits**
* Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage
* Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
* Flexible schedule and life work balance
* Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
* Very positive work environment in a young, international, and motivated team
* Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values



  
 



   
 



 Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.

title: Generative AI Engineer
company_industry: Software Development and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**Title** 
 - AI Engineer
 



**Location** 
 - Stockholm (Flexible Hybrid Model)
 



  





**Due to the urgency of these requirements, our client is only accepting applications from applicants who have the right to work and live in Europe.** 




  





**The Role** 




 Our client, a fast-growing AI startup based in Stockholm, is looking for an experienced AI Engineer to join their ambitious team and help shape the next generation of intelligent products.
 



  





 You’ll help build intelligent systems powered by modern language models, focusing on real-world applications like search, content generation, and automation. Your work will include building agentic workflows, designing scalable pipelines, and bringing AI prototypes into production.
 


* Develop systems based on LLMs, including retrieval-augmented generation, prompt chaining, and autonomous flows.
* Evaluate and fine-tune both open-source models and commercial LLM APIs (e.g., GPT-4o, Claude, Gemini).
* Design pipelines that combine knowledge graphs, embeddings, and vector search to surface structured information.
* Work closely with product and data teams to define and build meaningful user-facing features.
* Contribute to best practices around working with LLMs and help shape a future-forward engineering culture.



  





**About You** 



* A few years of experience (3+) building real-world AI/ML systems, especially those using LLMs.
* Strong coding ability, particularly in Python, and comfort working with modern ML libraries (PyTorch, HuggingFace, etc.).
* Experience designing or deploying vector search and embedding-based systems.
* You've deployed models into production and understand how to monitor and iterate in live environments.



  





**Bonus If You’ve...** 



* Contributed to open-source tooling or published in the AI/ML space.
* Explored agent-like systems or feedback-driven model training.



  





**Why It’s Interesting** 



* You’ll get access to cutting-edge LLM APIs and infrastructure for experimentation.
* There’s plenty of room to shape direction and drive forward an AI-first mindset.
* You’ll be part of a small, experienced team that values autonomy and product thinking.
* Competitive pay and equity, with flexible working built in.



  





**We would love to hear from you!** 




  





**Please apply now by sending your CV to Ronnie at ronnie.wilson@teletechpartners.com or contact teletech Partners on +44 203 640 7429.**

title: Business Manager – Fiber to the Home
description:
*Do you want full ownership of a key business area with commercial responsibility, budget ownership, and the opportunity to work closely with decision-makers across the company? Are you excited by data, structure, and strategy and want to turn that into action across pricing, offering, and performance? Then you might be who we’re looking for.*
 As Business Manager for our Single Dwelling Unit (SDU) segment, you’ll have full commercial ownership of one of our most strategically key areas in Sweden. You’ll be responsible for what we sell, how we price it, and how the business performs with the numbers to match.
   

  

 This role works across the organization and interacts with senior stakeholders, without having direct reports. Instead, you influence through facts, insights, and clarity. If you like having broad responsibility and aren’t afraid to dig into both big strategy and operational questions, this is the right place for you.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Set the commercial strategy for SDU (Fiber-to-the-home) and define the product and price offering
* Own the P&L, budget and forecasting for your area
* Follow up on results and turn insights into actions
* Lead cross-functional projects and align with marketing, sales, operations, and other teams
* Build clear presentations and communicate with stakeholders across the company


**Why join us at Global Connect?**
 You’ll step into a business area that matters. The SDU segment is a large and important part of our Swedish business. It’s a role with high visibility, clear ownership, and real impact both commercially and organizationally. You’ll work with skilled people who are driven by clarity, facts, and delivering what we say we will.
   

  

 Our team is based in Stockholm and works in a hybrid way. We’re small in number but work widely across the company. The tempo is high, and the topics vary but if you enjoy structure and accountability, it’s a wonderful place to be.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Think You Bring**
* A university degree in business, economics, or engineering
* Experience with commercial strategy, pricing, P&L, budget and forecasting
* Experience leading cross-functional work or projects
* Confidence presenting and working with stakeholders in both Swedish and English
* Experience from telecom or fiber is a plus, but not a must.


**How To Apply**
 We don’t need a personal letter unless there’s something you’d like to explain that isn’t in your CV or LinkedIn profile. Just send in your application and let’s connect.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Inside Sales Representative - Nordics
company_industry: Retail Apparel and Fashion, Financial Services, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**OUR STORY:**
 🇪🇺 Join Scaleway and shape the sovereign cloud of tomorrow !
   

  

 Since 1999, we have been designing secure, sustainable infrastructures aimed at supporting the most ambitious companies.
   

  

 Historically known for our dedicated servers (Dedibox), we made a strategic shift to cloud computing in 2015. Staying true to our principles of simplicity, flexibility, and technical excellence, we have become one of the leading players in Europe in the sector.
   

  

 With the rise of artificial intelligence, we have strengthened our commitment, supported by the Iliad Group, which is investing €3 billion to develop a serious, sovereign AI alternative to American and Asian giants.
   

  

 Every day, thanks to our rich catalog of products and services (bare metal, containerization, serverless, AI, etc.), Scaleway proudly serves 38,000 private and public sector clients, from Photoroom to Mistral AI, Golem AI, and ADEME.
   

  

 📍 Our offices are located in
 **Paris, Lille, Toulouse, Bordeaux, Rouen, Rennes and Lyon.**
**WHY WE NEED YOU?**
 Our growth is driving us to strengthen our Sales team to support our strategic expansion in the Nordic region.
   

  

 Your mission will be to identify and engage with key accounts in Sweden and across the Nordics in order to generate qualified opportunities for our Account Executives and contribute to our international business growth.
   

  

**YOUR FUTURE TEAM**
 We work in a collaborative and international environment where the diversity of Scalers, combined with a spirit of sharing, helps bring new projects to life every day, advancing our ambitions together.
   

  

 You will be part of a team of 11 people, working closely with Account Executives as a duo to develop a strong pipeline in your territory.
   

  

 The team is led by Pilar Balhadere and organized around a Manager, a Team Lead, and Inside Sales Representatives. Each ISR is assigned 200 strategic target accounts and works with sales architects and AEs to engage them through multi-channel outreach.
   

  

**YOUR DAILY ROUTINE**
* Conduct outbound prospecting via cold calls, cold emails, and social selling
* Manage email campaigns to generate qualified leads
* Map accounts and identify key stakeholders
* Collaborate closely with Account Executives on territory planning and deal strategy
* Use tools such as Outreach, Salesforce, Lusha, Humanlinker, and Confluence to manage your activity
* Track progress and report performance on your accounts
* Participate in team-based prospecting initiatives and events
* Continuously learn about Scaleway’s offerings and cloud industry trends
* Engage with technical teams when needed to address prospect needs
* Maintain a hunting and growth-oriented mindset


**About You**
**HARDSKILLS :**
* 1+ year of experience in a Sales Development / Inside Sales / Business Development role
* Previous experience in IT, SaaS, or cloud environments (minimum 6 months to 1 year)
* Proficient with sales tools (Salesforce, Outreach, Lusha, etc.)
* Strong understanding of sales prospecting and outbound strategies
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Nice to Have : French


**SOFTSKILLS :**
* Strong hunter mindset: goal-driven, persistent, proactive
* Comfortable with cold calling and initiating conversations
* Social and charismatic: able to build rapport easily
* Team-oriented and collaborative
* Curious and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment


**🚀Why join the Scaleway adventure?**
 ✔ A rich and diverse product offering: Scaleway offers over 100 public cloud products in IaaS, PaaS, and AI.
   

  

 ✔ A cutting-edge technical environment: Scaleway provides modern infrastructures, including high-performance bare metal servers, to tackle exciting technical challenges.
   

  

 ✔ Commitment to responsible cloud: Scaleway is dedicated to a more responsible cloud, with data centers powered solely by renewable energy since 2017, minimizing our ecological footprint and holding top-level certification.
   

  

**🔜 THE NEXT STEPS …**
* Initial conversation with the Talent Acquisition team (30 min)
* Interview with the Business Development Manager to discuss your approach and experience (45 min)
* Business case in English with our Team Lead + Account Executive for the Nordic Region (1h)
* Interview with future team members to assess fit and collaboration potential (45 min)
* Final interview with our CSO, Doreen Pernel (30 min)


*At Scaleway, we are committed to building an inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone has a fair opportunity to thrive.*
*All applications are considered with care, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnic or social background, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.*
*We believe great ideas come from everywhere, and everyone which is why you should definitely apply.*

title: Agent Support Specialist
description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fueled by dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".
   

  

**How can you contribute and have an impact?**
* Main local interface with agent network for any end customer order related topics.
* Supervise management of invoicing and payment process + liaison with Finance & Financing 3rd party
* Support with insurance questions
* Support in issue management and problem solving.
* Support operations in system change requests
* Optimize and streamlining the processes, order check and documentation.
* Key liaison with Nissan's Business Centre Team in Budapest
* Key liaison with Santander and other banks
* Support with system suppliers
* Support with communication and information to agents.
* Support and back-up Agent System Section Manager.


**What are we looking for?**
* Minimum 1 year of professional experience, preferably within the automotive industry.
* Experience in an international, matrix organization is highly advantageous.
* Higher education at Bachelor's level in finance or equivalent experience.
* Proficiency in MS Excel; relevant SAP experience is a plus.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Strong problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to remain calm under pressure.
* Structured and detail-oriented.


 Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
   

  

 Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.
   

  

 Kista Sweden

title: SQL server DBA
description:
Hos oss på B3 DBAce värdesätter vi en stark företagskultur, sund värdering och ett starkt fokus på våra medarbetare. Detta, i kombination med utmärkta möjligheter för kompetensutveckling, konkurrenskraftiga förmåner, och en inkluderande gemenskap, gör oss till en attraktiv arbetsgivare. Är det du som blir nästa nyckelperson i vårt team?
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

 Som SQL server DBA hos oss kommer du att vara involverad i varierande och utmanande projekt med våra kunder. Du kan få arbeta som resurskonsult ute hos kunder, sköta driftåtaganden på distans, eller kombinera båda. Denna roll erbjuder även möjligheter att arbeta i team tillsammans med andra delar av B3, där du kan dra nytta av och bidra till en bred kunskapsbas och nätverk.
   

  

 Din bakgrund:
   

  

* Arbetserfarenhet med MS SQL server, antingen som drift- eller utvecklings-DBA.
* Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av andra databaser än MS SQL Server, samt molntjänster som Azure eller AWS.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.


 För att trivas som konsult hos oss är du ansvarsfull, flexibel och självgående. Du gillar att hitta lösningar och att både dela med dig av din kunskap och be om hjälp när det behövs. Det viktigaste är din passion för DBA-rollen!
   

  

 Om B3 DBAce:
   

  

 B3 DBAce är specialiserade inom databas- och datahanteringsplattformar. Vi är ett team av 20 engagerade kollegor i roller som DBA, databasutvecklare, dataingenjör och dataarkitekt. Vi arbetar främst med databashanterare som MS SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL och PostgreSQL. Våra uppdrag är ofta långsiktiga hos kunder, men vi värdesätter också möjligheten att träffas på våra kontor i Stockholm, Örebro eller Göteborg för att utbyta tankar och idéer.
   

  

 Intresserad?
   

  

 Hoppas du känner ett ”JA, jag är nyfiken!” Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser!
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**
*B3 DBAce är en del av B3-koncernen, utsedd till Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work och till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord: erfarenhet, olikheter och energi. Vi satsar på hållbarhet i allt vi gör och tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre, därför erbjuder vi regelbundna wellness-aktiviteter som yoga, simning, löpning, musikquiz, stickcafé och föreläsningar om stress och mental hälsa."*

title: Software Engineer - Java/AWS/DevOps
description:
**This is Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 At Worldline, delivering a fantastic payment experience that our customers love is what drives us forward. Our cloud-native acquiring platform is processing billions of card transactions including authorization processing and clearing & settlement for our customers to trust. Currently, we are looking for a skilled product-oriented DevOps Software Engineer to team up with one of our product-oriented DevOps teams.
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
 Our autonomous teams work with a lean product focused DevOps culture that continuously delivers true outcome, and if you build it, you run it! This means that you are responsible for:
   

  

* Active participation and contribution in all phases of the product lifecycle including discovery, delivery and operations
* Delivering your team’s committed objectives, adapting to whatever is needed to reach the goal you and your team have committed yourselves to reach
* Securing an outstanding qualitative service availability 24/7/365 and on-call duty is expected according to a rotating schedule


 You love identifying the outcomes to be achieved together with your team, our customers, our internal users, other stakeholders and suppliers to deliver a truly outstanding acquiring processing experience for our customer and our business to love.
   

  

**What Makes You Stand Out**
* You are a junior to mid-experienced Software Engineer used to full-cycle DevOps mode
* You have been developing in Java/AWS for some time exposed to micro-services and serverless technologies
* Have highly collaborative attitude, setting your team first while also successfully collaborating with others
* You are comfortable in a fast-moving and agile culture - handling many different stakeholders, prioritizations and fast decisions is not an issue for you
* If you have previous experience from the card-payment industry, preferably acquiring processing or other transaction intense industry where scale is important that’s a big advantage
* Being passionate about delivering a payment acquiring experience that brings value for our customers and our business
* Acting as a role model for your team and others by paying attention to commitment, accountability and the true outcome for yourself, your team, our customers and internal users


**Who Are We Looking For**
 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. You also have:
   

  

* Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, engineering or other meaningful field Have confirmed experience in software development including Java, Python and SQL etc.
* Experience from high-available micro-services and serverless architecture and design leveraging on the AWS cloud for scalability and resilience.
* As a result, we would like you also to have some experience in/interest for
* AWS cloud services including DynamoDB, Lambdas, S3 etc.
* Infrastructure as code using Terraform and CloudFormation
* Continuous delivery pipelines using Jenkins and GIT
* Docker
* Knowledge secure coding
* A deep understanding of software quality assurance principles
* Fluency in English (Swedish is an advantage)
* Valid working permit for Sweden (office location is Stockholm)


**Skills We’d Like**
* Experience from DevOps ways of working and lean culture
* Paying attention to commitment, accountability and result for yourself and for your team.
* Experience from developing secure and/or PCI-DSS certified solutions is considered an advantage
* Good communication and presentation abilities
* Challenging status quo
* Having a technical and curious mindset, continuously learning and sharing your knowledge with your peers and others.


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2: nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape the evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we are looking for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

 Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com
   

  

 We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Frontend Engineer – Growth Web
description:
**Join Aira's mission to transform Europe's energy future**
 Are you passionate about building exceptional web experiences that drive growth and build iconic brands? Join Aira, a pioneering Swedish tech company, and help us craft our digital front door with cutting-edge frontend technology!
   

  

 Aira is at the forefront of clean energy technology. 10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**We are now looking for a talented Frontend Engineer to join our team in Stockholm, focusing on our public website and lead generation platform.**
 This is a unique opportunity to take technical ownership of our most visible platform, ensuring it not only converts visitors into leads but also consistently elevates our brand perception through high-performance, scalable web solutions.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
* Engineer high-impact web applications using React and Next.js — not just shipping features, but shaping how our lead generation platform drives measurable business results. You’ll own both the discovery and technical implementation, ensuring our public website scales with business needs.
* Turn business goals into technical architecture. You’ll work closely with product, marketing, and data teams to translate requirements into scalable systems that optimize for conversions, performance, and future growth.
* Optimize for performance and discoverability. From Core Web Vitals to SEO strategy and A/B testing infrastructure, you’ll design solutions that allow the company to make informed, data-driven decisions.
* Architect and integrate headless CMS workflows that empower non-technical teams while maintaining engineering quality, performance, and scalability.
* Own reliability at scale. You’ll deploy and maintain production applications on Vercel, establish CI/CD pipelines, monitor key metrics, and ensure near-perfect uptime for a mission-critical lead generation platform.
* Shape the product as much as the code. Beyond development, you’ll participate in discovery and decision-making — influencing how we reach 5 million homes by 2034.


**What You'll Bring To The Role**
* React & Next.js expertise — 3+ years building production-grade applications using modern patterns (SSR, SSG, ISR, API routes)
* Systems thinking — ability to design, scale, and evolve architecture in line with fast-moving business needs
* Vercel deployment experience — hands-on knowledge of edge functions, performance tools, and CI/CD best practices
* Headless CMS integration — proven track record with Contentful, Sanity, Strapi, or similar
* SEO mastery — deep knowledge of technical SEO and Core Web Vitals optimization
* A/B testing & CRO — ability to set up experimentation frameworks and act on behavioral data
* Data-driven development — comfort working with analytics and using insights to shape technical decisions


**Essential Skills:**
* TypeScript proficiency
* Advanced CSS skills (Tailwind CSS preferred)
* API integration and data fetching optimization
* Multi-language/international site development
* Performance monitoring and debugging
* Multi-language/international website development


**Professional Requirements:**
* 4 days per week in our Stockholm office
* Strong English communication skills
* Experience working in fast-paced, growth-focused environments


**Please note**
 As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.
   

  

 Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!
   

  

**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth
* Work with cutting-edge frontend technologies and modern development practices
* Enjoy our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Risk Manager
description:
Amsterdam, Netherlands
   

  

 Effective risk management involves a holistic view of various types of risks (e.g. insurance risk, operational risk, financial risk, etc.) and their interactions with each other. Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) enables informed strategic thinking, better decision making, and enhances the ability of the business to respond quickly in a dynamic and challenging environment.
   

  

 You will be working in the Risk function, based in the Amsterdam office with a proportion of remote working possible, and be involved in a range of Risk activities for the XLICSE Benelux and Nordics branches, as the main focus, and for the wider risk function of XLICSE. The key role of the Risk Manager is the identification, management and monitoring of operational risks in the XLICSE Benelux and Nordics branches
   

  

 You will report to the Deputy CRO XLICSE with a second reporting line to the local branch country manager.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

**What will your** 
**essential responsibilities include?**
* Working effectively with the XLICSE Benelux and Nordics branches in the identification, management and monitoring of operational risks. This will include coordinating the submission of operational incidents, production of the annual Operational Risk Assessment, presentation at local governance forums and tracking of these risks.
* Member of the Benelux and Nordics branch Leadership team representing the risk function which includes participation in Leadership team meetings, local governance forums and attendance at Northern Europe Leadership Team seminars.
* Provide risk training as relevant at leadership team level and across the branch as required.
* Production of the quarterly Benelux and Nordics branch risk dashboards and presentation at local branch governance forums and XLICSE Audit, Risk and Compliance Committee.
* Contribute to 2nd opinion on business plan for XLICSE with identification of key local strategic risks for XLICSE Benelux and Nordics branches.
* Support roll out of policies and procedures across the branch, including enhancement of risk culture.
* Support roll out of internal control framework across the Benelux and Nordics branches, including testing as applicable for local controls.
* While based in Amsterdam, you will travel to the Nordics branch (Stockholm) on a quarterly basis.
* Working closely with the XLICSE Risk team based in Dublin in supporting XLICSE wide risk activities, e.g. project risk assessments, and collaborating with the other European Branch risk managers on emerging risks and issues.
* Collaborating with the AXA XL Centres of Excellence, as required, for example information risk management.
* Support any ad hoc regulatory request, locally or from the Central Bank of Ireland.
* Engage with internal audit, as required.
* As part of the ERM team, identify any shortfall in expected compliance with the emerging regulatory requirements and aid in developing plans to address any shortfall.


 What you’ll bring
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
   

  

**Required Skills And Abilities**
* Proven experience of working in a Risk, Compliance or Internal Audit function for an insurance company is essential.
* Enterprise Risk Management Framework experience, in particular the assessment of operational risk in a similar role.
* Experience in assimilating significant amounts of information for problem solving.
* Outstanding analysis skills (both quantitative and qualitative).
* Clear communication, written and presentation, will be important for presenting results and solutions.
* Thorough data interpretation skills and attention to detail are a must to ensure producing high quality, reliable analysis.


**Desired Skills And Abilities**
* You will be working in a dynamic, geographically dispersed team so you will need to be highly adaptable and comfortable both working on your own initiative and as a keen team player.
* Graduate degree and/or studying towards an insurance or Risk Management qualification (e.g. FRM, CFA).


 Who we are
   

  

 AXA XL, the P&C and specialty risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don’t just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it.
   

  

 How? By combining a comprehensive and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business − property, casualty, professional, financial lines and specialty.
   

  

 With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward.
   

  

 Learn more at axaxl.com
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

**Inclusion**
 AXA XL is committed to equal employment opportunity and will consider applicants regardless of gender, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity and origins, marital status, religion, disability, or any other protected characteristic. At AXA XL, we know that an inclusive culture and enables business growth and is critical to our success. That’s why we have made a strategic commitment to attract, develop, advance and retain the most inclusive workforce possible, and create a culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and reach their highest potential. It’s about helping one another — and our business — to move forward and succeed.
   

  

* Five Business Resource Groups focused on gender, LGBTQ+, ethnicity and origins, disability and inclusion with 20 Chapters around the globe.
* Robust support for Flexible Working Arrangements
* Enhanced family-friendly leave benefits
* Named to the Diversity Best Practices Index
* Signatory to the UK Women in Finance Charter


 Learn more at axaxl.com/about-us/inclusion-and-diversity. AXA XL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
   

  

**Total Rewards**
 AXA XL’s Reward program is designed to take care of what matters most to you, covering the full picture of your health, wellbeing, lifestyle and financial security. It provides competitive compensation and personalized, inclusive benefits that evolve as you do.
   

  

 We’re committed to rewarding your contribution for the long term, so you can be your best self today and look forward to the future with confidence.
   

  

**Sustainability**
 At AXA XL, Sustainability is integral to our business strategy. In an ever-changing world, AXA XL protects what matters most for our clients and communities. We know that sustainability is at the root of a more resilient future. Our 2023-26 Sustainability strategy, called “Roots of resilience”, focuses on protecting natural ecosystems, addressing climate change, and embedding sustainable practices across our operations.
   

  

**Our Pillars**
* Valuing nature: How we impact nature affects how nature impacts us. Resilient ecosystems - the foundation of a sustainable planet and society - are essential to our future. We’re committed to protecting and restoring nature - from mangrove forests to the bees in our backyard - by increasing biodiversity awareness and inspiring clients and colleagues to put nature at the heart of their plans.
* Addressing climate change: The effects of a changing climate are far-reaching and significant. Unpredictable weather, increasing temperatures, and rising sea levels cause both social inequalities and environmental disruption. We're building a net zero strategy, developing insurance products and services, and mobilizing to advance thought leadership and investment in societal-led solutions.
* Integrating ESG: All companies have a role to play in building a more resilient future. Incorporating ESG considerations into our internal processes and practices builds resilience from the roots of our business. We’re training our colleagues, engaging our external partners, and evolving our sustainability governance and reporting.
* AXA Hearts in Action: We have established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues support causes that matter most to them, known as AXA XL’s “Hearts in Action” programs. These include our Matching Gifts program, Volunteering Leave, and our annual volunteering day - the Global Day of Giving.


 For more information, please see axaxl.com/sustainability.

title: Säljare
description:
**Vi söker en nyfiken och passionerad Säljare och framtida Sortimentsägare** 

  






 Vi söker dig som är kundfokuserad och genuint gillar att vara med och lösa kundernas utmaningar både taktiskt och strategiskt. Vårt fokus är att utveckla våra långsiktiga kundrelationer med våra befintliga kunder genom att stödja dem i sin affär.
 




  





 För att nå framgång med våra kunder behöver du ha en grundläggande teknisk kunskap och vara lyhörd och nyfiken för att förstå kundernas prioriteringar och hur vi frigör värde för dem på bästa sätt. Våra kunder finns inom svensk tillverkningsindustri och it-sektorn, ofta med internationella filialer varför du bör tala och skriva både svenska och engelska flytande.
 



  





 På sikt vill vi att du tar ansvar för delar av produktportföljen som sortimentsägare där du kontinuerligt arbetar med affärsutveckling inom ditt område för att vi alltid ska ligga i framkant av utvecklingen. En stor del av vår affär stöttas digitalt av vår e-handel där du till stor del är ansvarig för relevant material och den specialistkunskap som förmedlas via våra plattformar.
 



  





**För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du är:** 



* Positiv och prestigelös - med glädje och vilja hittar vi en lösning för framgång gemensamt
* Nyfiken - genuin vilja att förstå både kundernas affär och produkternas tekniska värde
* En riktig lagspelare - med gott självledarskap och driv men med genuin omtanke för kunder och kollegor
* Lösningsorienterad - viljan att hitta en lösning för våra kunder skapar värde
* Ansvarstagande - klarar att ta eget ansvar och sätta högt uppsatta mål för ditt produktområde



  
 



**Direktronik** 
  är ett helägt dotterbolag i Lagercrantz Group (www.lagercrantz.com). Vi omsätter 155 MSEK med god lönsamhet och består idag över 35 medarbetare som arbetar från vårt huvudkontor/lager i Nynäshamn och från våra säljkontor i Sundbyberg, Bandhagen och Bergen i Norge.
 



 Vi importerar, förädlar, tillverkar och marknadsför produkter och komponenter främst för nätverk, kommunikation och industri. Vi hjälper våra kunder genom att erbjuda en 
 **hög tillgänglighet** 
 och ett
 **stort personligt engagemang** 
 .
 



 Vår ambition är alltid att tillhandahålla en snabb lösning på kunders problem på ett 
 **personligt och omtänksamt** 
  sätt genom hela kedjan, från order till användarsupport. Med ett brett utbud av produkter för data- och nätverkskommunikation, elektronikkomponenter och lösningar hjälper vi våra kunder i sin tekniska utveckling och vardag.
 



  





 Du bör klara att hantera friheten under ansvar, gilla att hjälpa varandra och främst våra kunder på 
 **snabbast möjliga sätt** 
 . Vi har vunnit SM i kundservice och för detta krävs att vi 
 **i alla delar av kundrelationen överträffar konkurrenterna.** 
 Vår ambition är att alltid tillhandahålla en snabb lösning på kunders problem på ett 
 **personligt och omtänksamt sätt** 
  genom hela kedjan, från order till användarsupport.
 



  





 Tidigare erfarenhet att fältförsäljning inom tekniksektorn är meriterande. Flytande Svenska och Engelska i tal och skrift, samt körkort B är ett krav för att effektivt kunna utföra arbetet.
 



  





 Vill du utvecklas tillsammans med oss ansöker du här eller skickar du ditt CV via mail till info@direktronik.se – så snart möjligt, rekryteringsprocessen sker löpande. Använd
 **Säljare/sortimentsägare** 
 i ämnesraden.

title: Channel Account Manager
description:
🏆 Come and join
 **Pax8** 
 ,
 **Microsoft's Global Partner of the Year 2024** 
 , as a
 **Business Development Manager** 
 , based in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 in our stellar Sales Team
 **.** 
**🚀**
 It's an exciting time to become part of Pax8 Sweden as we enter the next significant stage of our incredible growth. This role offers immense opportunities to make an impact, build your legacy, and contribute to our mission.
   

  

**📍 Hybrid Role | Based in Stockhom | Travel across Sweden & Europe required**
**Your Mission as our Channel Account Manager**
 As a cloud and marketplace expert, you will identify and understand customer business objectives, providing solutions to address their pain points and ultimately enable growth within their business also.
   

  

 Take ownership of the sales cycle, from identifying prospects to closing new business, with a focus on driving revenue and increasing Pax8 market share.
   

  

 You will utilise the Pax8 sales methodology to manage sales funnels and build strategic relationships with partners.
   

  

**🚀
 *We are a high growth US company with significant investment in international markets within EMEA and APAC. We are the best in class with YOY growth in consecutive years from start up in EMEA.***
**🚀**
**Learn more about our journey and achievements by checking out these articles:**
* Exciting Times at Pax8- meet our new CEO
* Pax8 recognised as Microsoft Partner of the year 2024
* Pax8 unveils next Generation Marketplace Experience
* Exciting Times - meet our new CEO
* Pax8 Nordic Expansion


 We win awards for our people's hard work and the positive experiences they have while doing it. For that reason, we are proud to have just been certified as a
 **'Great Place to Work'** 
 .
   

  

**As a Channel Account Manager, your day to day includes:**
* Serving as a cloud technology expert providing business solutions to resolve pain points for our partners
* Understanding partners business objectives and identify best solutions
* Expanding our partner network through partner acquisition and active involvement in events.
* Managing your sales cycle, identifying prospects and closing new business with the primary goal of driving revenue and increasing Pax8 market share
* Building relationships with our partner sales teams and strategizing on new sales opportunities
* Supporting other Channel Account Managers and sharing those wins as a team


**Culturally you’ll be comfortable in, and perhaps come from, a complex, fast growing technology business.**
**You'll be the ideal Channel Account Manager for us if you:**
* are an excellent Swedish speaker with proficient English language skills, both written and spoken.
* have demonstrated sales/account management experience in the channel or in IT Sales e.g. Software as a Service
* have an interest in cloud technology products and services and can demonstrate a solid understanding of business technology
* are a storyteller and team player
* embrace an authentic approach to selling within a team environment, with a commitment to achieving outstanding sales results
* bring resilience and drive — this is a fast-paced, results-driven environment where ambition pays off
* are willing to travel across Sweden and abroad


 To fulfil this role you should be resident in this country with a valid right to work.
   

  

**We encourage you to apply for a role at Pax8 even if you don’t meet 100% of the bullet points! We believe in cultivating an environment where is are a diversity of perspectives.**
 We take pride in our diverse and multicultural work environment, where communication is key. Our team collectively speaks more than 23 languages, reflecting the richness of our global community.
   

  

 We review and acknowledge every application using real humans - Our Talent team are based in the UK and Netherlands - Please look out for a response from us to your application in your inbox but check spam too!
   

  

 If you struggle to get “time out” we’re happy to accommodate early/late conversations and interview times or if you have any queries you can ring the Talent Partner, Victoria, managing this role on +44 117 457 7913. (No Agencies Please)
   

  

**Pax8 Working Environment & Benefits**
* OTE salary of up to SEK 615,000 gross yearly (depending on experience)
* Long term Incentive Plan (Stock Options after qualified period)
* Dedicated time for training and personal development
* Health & Wellbeing coaching support
* Regular trips to our European offices
* Social and community events


**What's in it for you?**
 Pax8 is a learning accelerant. If you are
 **growth minded and curious** 
 , there’s plenty of scope for talented individuals to progress quickly in this opportunity or to other internal options (internal mobility in 2023 was 34%) as we grow and expand. We have our very own internal "Elev8" Academy, Pax8 University & LinkedIn Learning for personal development plus access to Learning & Development specialist trainers and extensive "born in the cloud" mentors available for your growth. We’ll provide the opportunity, stretch and projects to help you thrive and see exactly what you need to achieve to get to the next level.
   

  

**Why Pax8?**
 Pax8 is the technology marketplace of the future, linking partners, vendors, and small to midsized businesses (SMBs) through AI-powered insights and comprehensive product support. With a global partner ecosystem of over 35,000 managed service providers, Pax8 empowers SMBs worldwide by providing software and services that unlock their growth potential and enhance their security. Committed to innovating cloud commerce at scale, Pax8 drives customer acquisition and solution consumption across its entire ecosystem.
   

  

 As part of our hiring process, we are required to undertake information verification checks on all candidates that are successful in their application with Pax8. As part of these checks Pax8 will request ID verification, reference requests and qualification checks (additional checks will be completed for UK candidates only, such as criminal and financial). All checks are completed by our third-party provider, Vero. Once checks have been completed all candidates will receive a copy for their records.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 Pax8 are an equal opportunities employer and welcome individuals who are in possession of the appropriate requirements to work within the country the role is based in. Offered individuals will be asked to undertake identity, security compliance and reference checks. Your privacy is important to us. Your data will be held in accordance with GDPR best practices and processed only in accordance with our recruiting processes.
   

  

 Job Applicant Privacy Notice (https://www.pax8.com/en-us/terms/job-applicant-privacy-notice/)
