title: PLM CONSULTANT
description:
### **Job Applicant Privacy Notice**


**PLM CONSULTANT**
==================

Publication Date: Oct 10, 2025
Ref. No: 536309
Location:
Linkoping, SE Albertslund, DK
**About Atos Group**

  



Atos Group is a global leader in digital transformation with c. 70,000 employees and annual revenue of c. € 10 billion, operating in 67 countries under two brands — Atos for services and Eviden for products. European number one in cybersecurity, cloud and high-performance computing, Atos Group is committed to a secure and decarbonized future and provides tailored AI-powered, end-to-end solutions for all industries. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea) and listed on Euronext Paris.

  



The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education and research in a multicultural approach and contribute to the development of scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the Group enables its customers and employees, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably, in a safe and secure information space.

  


**About the role**

  



We are seeking a motivated and knowledgeable PLM Specialist to join our dedicated team. This role is ideal for someone with a strong interest in Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), engineering processes, and related software systems—particularly those within the Siemens ecosystem.



As a PLM Specialist, you will play a critical role in configuring, customizing, implementing, and supporting our PLM solutions to meet business needs and enhance operational efficiency. Our work primarily focuses on Siemens Teamcenter and its integrations with tools like NX, although prior experience with all these technologies is not required. A strong willingness to learn and adapt is essential.

  



Location: Sweden, Denmark

  


**Key Responsibilities**

  


* Configure, customize, implement, and maintain PLM systems, primarily Siemens Teamcenter.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams—including engineering, manufacturing, IT, and business users—to gather requirements and deploy PLM solutions.
* Develop and implement PLM system functionalities, including BMIDE, workflows, stylesheets, scripting, and integrations.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues within the PLM environment.
* Provide training, support, and guidance to PLM system users.
* Participate in design reviews to ensure alignment with PLM best practices.
* Manage system upgrades, patches, and enhancements.
* Stay current with PLM trends and technologies, particularly within the Siemens ecosystem.
* Contribute throughout the PLM implementation lifecycle, from requirements gathering to deployment and maintenance.
* Assist with data migration activities for PLM implementations.

  


**Qualifications**

  


* Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Experience with PLM system administration, preferably Siemens Teamcenter (e.g., BMIDE, workflows, access rules).
* Solid understanding of PLM fundamentals: Bill of materials management, change/document control, CAD data management.
* Familiarity with engineering and manufacturing processes is highly desirable.
* Experience with CAD software, especially NX, and its PLM integration is a strong plus.
* Knowledge of programming or scripting languages such as C++, Java, XML, SQL, or similar is beneficial.
* Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving abilities.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration across technical and non-technical teams.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative, multi-disciplinary team.

  


**What We Offer**

  


* Flexibility and work-from-home policy
* International teamwork & collaboration
* Work closely with executive management
* Have a positive impact on the organization
* Possibility to work abroad with international clients.

  



Join us in delivering innovative PLM solutions that make a real impact on our clients’ operations. Whether you’re at the start of your PLM journey or building on existing experience, this role offers a dynamic and growth-oriented environment.

  


**Let’s grow together.**

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:

title: AWS - ISV Partner Account Manager - Public Sector - Europe North
description:
**Description**
 Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for pioneering candidates to help develop and manage our partnerships with leading independent software vendors (ISV) within the Europe North market (BeNeLux, Nordics, Baltics).
   

  

 As an ISV Partner Account Manager within the AWS Public Sector team, you will join a friendly and supportive team and have the exciting opportunity to help execute on our strategy to build mind share and drive adoption of AWS services across AWS’s most strategic business partners and their customers.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud.
   

  

 Join us and help us grow.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include driving executive and field relationships with leading ISVs, practically impacting Public Sector AWS adoption. By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with these partners, you will help to drive overall end customer adoption with the Public Sector segments.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will possess both a business background that enables them to engage at the CxO level, as well as a customer facing background that enables them to easily interact with public sector customers and AWS team members.
   

  

 They should also have a demonstrable ability to think big about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to convey compelling value propositions which help partners deliver sustainable business value and assist customers in accomplishing their mission.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in the North European Information Technology industry with ability to influence C-level decision makers as well as field based resources.
* Track record of success building trusted relationships with customers / partners
* Strong Sales / Resuls orientation
* Verbal and written communications skills and ability to articulate complex concepts
* Ability to work effectively across large and sometimes complex internal and external organizations
* Operating skills (forecasting, pipeline management, account planning, business cadence)
* Fluent Swedish and English
* Technical acumen, with a demonstrated track record of driving emerging/disruptive technologies, virtualization, Software as a Service delivery models and AWS Marketplace


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Master's degree in a technical discipline and/or MBA or equivalent
* Good understanding of the Europe North public sector and partner landscape.

title: Channel Account Manager
description:
🏆 Come and join
 **Pax8** 
 ,
 **Microsoft's Global Partner of the Year 2024** 
 , as a
 **Business Development Manager** 
 , based in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 in our stellar Sales Team
 **.** 
**🚀**
 It's an exciting time to become part of Pax8 Sweden as we enter the next significant stage of our incredible growth. This role offers immense opportunities to make an impact, build your legacy, and contribute to our mission.
   

  

**📍 Hybrid Role | Based in Stockhom | Travel across Sweden & Europe required**
**Your Mission as our Channel Account Manager**
 As a cloud and marketplace expert, you will identify and understand customer business objectives, providing solutions to address their pain points and ultimately enable growth within their business also.
   

  

 Take ownership of the sales cycle, from identifying prospects to closing new business, with a focus on driving revenue and increasing Pax8 market share.
   

  

 You will utilise the Pax8 sales methodology to manage sales funnels and build strategic relationships with partners.
   

  

**🚀
 *We are a high growth US company with significant investment in international markets within EMEA and APAC. We are the best in class with YOY growth in consecutive years from start up in EMEA.***
**🚀**
**Learn more about our journey and achievements by checking out these articles:**
* Exciting Times at Pax8- meet our new CEO
* Pax8 recognised as Microsoft Partner of the year 2024
* Pax8 unveils next Generation Marketplace Experience
* Exciting Times - meet our new CEO
* Pax8 Nordic Expansion


 We win awards for our people's hard work and the positive experiences they have while doing it. For that reason, we are proud to have just been certified as a
 **'Great Place to Work'** 
 .
   

  

**As a Channel Account Manager, your day to day includes:**
* Serving as a cloud technology expert providing business solutions to resolve pain points for our partners
* Understanding partners business objectives and identify best solutions
* Expanding our partner network through partner acquisition and active involvement in events.
* Managing your sales cycle, identifying prospects and closing new business with the primary goal of driving revenue and increasing Pax8 market share
* Building relationships with our partner sales teams and strategizing on new sales opportunities
* Supporting other Channel Account Managers and sharing those wins as a team


**Culturally you’ll be comfortable in, and perhaps come from, a complex, fast growing technology business.**
**You'll be the ideal Channel Account Manager for us if you:**
* are an excellent Swedish speaker with proficient English language skills, both written and spoken.
* have demonstrated sales/account management experience in the channel or in IT Sales e.g. Software as a Service
* have an interest in cloud technology products and services and can demonstrate a solid understanding of business technology
* are a storyteller and team player
* embrace an authentic approach to selling within a team environment, with a commitment to achieving outstanding sales results
* bring resilience and drive — this is a fast-paced, results-driven environment where ambition pays off
* are willing to travel across Sweden and abroad


 To fulfil this role you should be resident in this country with a valid right to work.
   

  

**We encourage you to apply for a role at Pax8 even if you don’t meet 100% of the bullet points! We believe in cultivating an environment where is are a diversity of perspectives.**
 We take pride in our diverse and multicultural work environment, where communication is key. Our team collectively speaks more than 23 languages, reflecting the richness of our global community.
   

  

 We review and acknowledge every application using real humans - Our Talent team are based in the UK and Netherlands - Please look out for a response from us to your application in your inbox but check spam too!
   

  

 If you struggle to get “time out” we’re happy to accommodate early/late conversations and interview times or if you have any queries you can ring the Talent Partner, Victoria, managing this role on +44 117 457 7913. (No Agencies Please)
   

  

**Pax8 Working Environment & Benefits**
* OTE salary of up to SEK 615,000 gross yearly (depending on experience)
* Long term Incentive Plan (Stock Options after qualified period)
* Dedicated time for training and personal development
* Health & Wellbeing coaching support
* Regular trips to our European offices
* Social and community events


**What's in it for you?**
 Pax8 is a learning accelerant. If you are
 **growth minded and curious** 
 , there’s plenty of scope for talented individuals to progress quickly in this opportunity or to other internal options (internal mobility in 2023 was 34%) as we grow and expand. We have our very own internal "Elev8" Academy, Pax8 University & LinkedIn Learning for personal development plus access to Learning & Development specialist trainers and extensive "born in the cloud" mentors available for your growth. We’ll provide the opportunity, stretch and projects to help you thrive and see exactly what you need to achieve to get to the next level.
   

  

**Why Pax8?**
 Pax8 is the technology marketplace of the future, linking partners, vendors, and small to midsized businesses (SMBs) through AI-powered insights and comprehensive product support. With a global partner ecosystem of over 35,000 managed service providers, Pax8 empowers SMBs worldwide by providing software and services that unlock their growth potential and enhance their security. Committed to innovating cloud commerce at scale, Pax8 drives customer acquisition and solution consumption across its entire ecosystem.
   

  

 As part of our hiring process, we are required to undertake information verification checks on all candidates that are successful in their application with Pax8. As part of these checks Pax8 will request ID verification, reference requests and qualification checks (additional checks will be completed for UK candidates only, such as criminal and financial). All checks are completed by our third-party provider, Vero. Once checks have been completed all candidates will receive a copy for their records.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 Pax8 are an equal opportunities employer and welcome individuals who are in possession of the appropriate requirements to work within the country the role is based in. Offered individuals will be asked to undertake identity, security compliance and reference checks. Your privacy is important to us. Your data will be held in accordance with GDPR best practices and processed only in accordance with our recruiting processes.
   

  

 Job Applicant Privacy Notice (https://www.pax8.com/en-us/terms/job-applicant-privacy-notice/)

title: Konsult Microsoft Dynamics 365
description:
**Konsult Dynamics 365**
**Din roll**
 Accelerera din karriär och bli nästa generations konsult inom Microsoft Dynamics 365 för Finance och Supply Chain (AX) & Microsoft Dynamics Customer Engagement (CRM)! Som konsult hos Sogeti kommer du att stötta några av de största, mest älskade varumärkena i Europa på deras digitala transformationsresa.
   

  

**I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:**
* Att arbeta med Microsoft Dynamics, antingen som konsult, superanvändare, processägare eller i samband med implementeringsprojekt.
* Att briljera i rollen som konsult och stötta kunder på deras digitala transformationsresa.
* Att använda din erfarenhet av processkunskap inom finance eller manufacturing för att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar.
* Att bidra till utveckling och implementering av ERP/CRM-system.


**Din profil**
* 2-3 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av processkunskap inom finance eller manufacturing.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsoft Dynamics eller annan ERP/CRM-plattform, antingen som konsult, superanvändare, processägare eller i liknande roll.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i samband med en ERP/CRM-implementering.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**
* Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
* Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
* Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
* Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.


**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan idag, urval sker löpande! Hoppas vi ses! Vill du veta mer? Kontakta TA Partner Marta Sundell så berättar hon gärna mer.
   

  

 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 21 kontor och 1300 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: Senior Product Manager – ESG Solutions (Nordics)
description:
At Infor, we build industry-specific cloud solutions that empower businesses to run smarter and more sustainably. With ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) regulations reshaping how companies operate and report, we are expanding our product team to deliver innovative capabilities that help our customers meet these challenges head-on.
   

  

 We are now seeking a Senior Product Manager with expertise in ESG, sustainability reporting, and enterprise applications to join our dynamic team.
   

  

 A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
   

  

 · Drive the product strategy and roadmap for Infor’s ESG and sustainability solutions, with a focus on integration into ERP, supply chain, and financial applications.
   

  

 · Partner with engineering, UX, and industry strategy teams to deliver features that support compliance with CSRD, ESRS, CSDDD, and related global ESG regulations.
   

  

 · Collaborate with customers, industry experts, and regulatory bodies to anticipate market needs and translate them into clear product requirements.
   

  

 · Ensure seamless ESG data collection, analytics, and reporting capabilities across Infor CloudSuites.
   

  

 · Define and track key success metrics to measure product adoption and impact.
   

  

 Basic Qualifications:
   

  

 · Proven experience (5-10 years) in product management within enterprise software, ERP, supply chain, or sustainability solutions.
   

  

 · Strong understanding of ESG frameworks and regulations (CSRD, ESRS, SFDR, EU Taxonomy, etc.).
   

  

 · Demonstrated ability to translate complex regulatory and market requirements into practical software capabilities.
   

  

 · Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to work across global, cross-functional teams.
   

  

 · Strategic thinker with a passion for driving innovation in sustainability and compliance.
   

  

 · Good presentation skills
   

  

 Why join Infor:
   

  

 · Be a global leader in industry-specific cloud software.
   

  

 · Shape solutions that directly help companies meet their ESG goals and regulatory obligations.
   

  

 · Collaborate with passionate teams at the intersection of technology, compliance, and sustainability.
   

  

 · Competitive compensation and benefits.
   

  

 About Infor
   

  

 Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
   

 For more information visit www.infor.com
   

  

 Our Values
   

  

 At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called [1] Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.
   

  

 We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.
   

  

 Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.
   

  

 At Infor we value your privacy that’s why we created a policy that you can read [2] here.
   

  

  

 References
   

  

 Visible links
   

 1. https://www.kochind.com/about/business-philosophy
   

 2. https://www.infor.com/about/privacy

title: Hardware Systems Architect - Optical Transponders
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Telecommunications
description:
**Job Description**
 In an increasingly connected world, the pandemic has highlighted just how essential telecom networks are to keeping society running. The Network Infrastructure group is at the heart of a revolution to connectivity, pushing the boundaries to deliver more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise
   

  

 Join Optical Networks division, where innovation meets scale in the AI-driven data center era. With the recent acquisition of Infinera, we’ve united two industry leaders to create an optical networking powerhouse—combining cutting-edge technology with proven leadership to redefine the future of connectivity.
   

  

 As a Hardware Architect at Nokia, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our leading DWDM transmission systems. You will develop and maintain innovative product architectures and detailed features for high-capacity transponders, ensuring compliance with industry standards such as ITU-T G.709 and G.798. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, providing technical guidance and support to R&D, product management, and customer teams. Our fast-paced, dynamic work environment fosters creativity and innovation, allowing you to leverage the latest industry trends and your hands-on HDL design experience to tackle complex challenges. You'll work directly with cutting-edge technology while contributing to a collaborative, multi-national team dedicated to pushing the boundaries of telecommunications. Join us in creating next-gen optical transport solutions that empower connectivity around the globe.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn**
* Design and innovate product architectures for packet-optical telecommunications focused on performance, cost, and capacity.
* Analyze market requirements and industry standards (e.g., ITU-T G.709, ITU-T G.798) to define detailed product features.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, offering technical support to R&D, product management, and customer teams.
* Coordinate development of features and concepts, aligning with operational requirements and use cases.
* Apply hands-on HW design experience to create solutions for high data rates (beyond 100Gbit/s).
* Stay abreast of telecommunications trends, ensuring designs meet industry benchmarks and customer expectations.
* Lead and mentor team members in a multidisciplinary, multi-site global environment.
* Communicate architectural concepts and project progress effectively to stakeholders and partners.
* Good technical understanding of optical network equipment, such as transport and switching network elements for OTN, DWDM and Ethernet transport; optical interfaces for DWDM systems; OTN and SDH protection technologies and synchronization in telecommunication networks.


**Key Skills And Experience**
**You have:**
* BSc/MSc/PhD degree in relevant field
* Minimum 5 years experience in hardware development for telecommunication systems
* In-depth knowledge of ITU-T G.709 and Ethernet standards (IEEE 802.3)
